intro: Uapaca brieyi, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe, containing a single seed. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, thriving in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also valued in traditional herbal medicine.
